title: OECD Education Attainment Dashboard
text:
Overview
This interactive flexdashboard provides a comparative analysis of educational attainment levels between native-born and foreign-born populations across OECD member countries (plus Bulgaria and Romania). The dashboard enables exploration of education-migration intersections through interactive visualizations.

title: OECD Education Attainment Dashboard
text:
Dashboard Features

üìä Stacked Bar Chart

Compare native-born vs.¬†foreign-born populations
Educational levels: Below upper secondary, Upper secondary, Tertiary
Country-specific analysis with aggregation over selected years



üåç Interactive World Map

Choropleth visualization of OECD + EU countries
Filter by birth place (native/foreign-born)
Filter by education level
Natural Earth projection for global context



‚öôÔ∏è Interactive Controls



Control
Description




Country
Select country for bar chart comparison


Birth place
Native-born or Foreign-born filter for map


Education level
Filter map by educational attainment


Year range
Slider for temporal aggregation

title: OECD Education Attainment Dashboard
text:
Technical Implementation


Code
# Core libraries
library(flexdashboard)
library(shiny)
library(dplyr)
library(plotly)
library(arrow)

# Data loaded from Parquet format (efficient columnar storage)
educ <- arrow::read_parquet("OECD_EducAtt.parquet")

# Interactive bar chart with plotly
plot_ly(
  data  = df_top,
  x     = ~BirthPlace,
  y     = ~Value,
  color = ~EducLevel,
  type  = "bar"
) %>%
  layout(barmode = "stack")

# Interactive choropleth map
plot_ly(
  df_map,
  type = "choropleth",
  locations = ~CountryCode,
  z = ~Value,
  locationmode = "ISO-3"
) %>%
  layout(
    geo = list(
      projection = list(type = "natural earth")
    )
  )

title: OECD Education Attainment Dashboard
text:
Data Sources

OECD Education at a Glance - Educational attainment statistics
OECD.Stat - Migration and education cross-tabulations
Data stored in Apache Parquet format for efficient loading

title: OECD Education Attainment Dashboard
text:
Key Insights Enabled
The dashboard facilitates analysis of:

Integration outcomes - How do foreign-born populations compare in educational attainment?
Country differences - Which countries show largest gaps between native and foreign-born?
Temporal trends - How have patterns changed over time?
Education levels - At which levels are gaps most pronounced?

title: OECD Education Attainment Dashboard
text:
Deployment Options

Option 1: ShinyApps.io
# Flexdashboard with runtime: shiny requires Shiny server
rsconnect::deployApp("NIKOLOV_GlobalMacroMonitor_OECD.Rmd")


Option 2: Posit Connect / Shiny Server
For organizational deployment with enhanced features.


Option 3: Run Locally
rmarkdown::run("NIKOLOV_GlobalMacroMonitor_OECD.Rmd")

title: Spatial Inequality in Central and Eastern Europe
text: This visualization presents a geospatial analysis of regional inequalities across Central and Eastern European (CEE) countries. The map reveals spatial patterns of economic development, highlighting urban-rural divides and cross-border disparities.

title: Spatial Inequality in Central and Eastern Europe
text: This visualization presents a geospatial analysis of regional inequalities across Central and Eastern European (CEE) countries. The map reveals spatial patterns of economic development, highlighting urban-rural divides and cross-border disparities.

Spatial Inequality in Central and Eastern Europe

title: Spatial Inequality in Central and Eastern Europe
text:
Methodology

Data Sources

Eurostat Regional Statistics - NUTS-2/NUTS-3 level data
GISCO (Geographic Information System of the Commission) - Spatial boundaries
National statistical offices - Supplementary regional data



Technical Approach


Code
# Key packages used
library(tidyverse)
library(sf)           # Simple features for spatial data
library(giscoR)       # Eurostat geographic data
library(ggplot2)

# Spatial data handling
# cee_regions <- gisco_get_nuts(
#   year = "2021",
#   resolution = "10",
#   nuts_level = "2"
# )

# Choropleth mapping
# Regional inequality indices
# Cross-border pattern analysis




Key Features

High-resolution regional mapping at NUTS-2/NUTS-3 level
Comparative cross-country analysis within CEE
Urban-rural gradient visualization

title: Spatial Inequality in Central and Eastern Europe
text:
Spatial Patterns Revealed
The analysis highlights several key patterns:







Pattern
Description




Capital city effect
Concentration of prosperity around capitals


East-West gradient
Persistent disparities within countries


Border effects
Economic differences at national boundaries


Industrial legacy
Impact of historical industrial centers

title: Intergenerational Education Mobility
text: This visualization explores intergenerational educational mobility in Austria, examining how educational attainment levels transmit across generations. The analysis reveals patterns of upward mobility, persistence, and barriers in educational achievement.

title: Intergenerational Education Mobility
text: This visualization explores intergenerational educational mobility in Austria, examining how educational attainment levels transmit across generations. The analysis reveals patterns of upward mobility, persistence, and barriers in educational achievement.

Intergenerational Education Mobility in Austria

text:
Methodology

Data Sources

OECD Education at a Glance - International education statistics
Statistik Austria - National education surveys
EU-LFS (Labour Force Survey) - Educational background data



Technical Approach


Code
# Key packages used
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggalluvial)  # for Sankey/alluvial diagrams

# Transition matrix calculation
# Parent education ‚Üí Child education flows
# Mobility index computation

# Visualization approaches:
# - Alluvial/Sankey diagrams for flows
# - Heatmaps for transition probabilities
# - Slope charts for generational comparison




Key Features

Flow visualization showing educational transitions
Quantified mobility metrics
Generational comparison framework

title: Intergenerational Education Mobility
text:
Interpretation
The visualization reveals:

Persistence patterns - Where educational attainment tends to be inherited
Upward mobility corridors - Paths of educational advancement
Structural barriers - Bottlenecks in educational progression

title: Migration in Austria
text:
Overview
This interactive Shiny application provides a comprehensive exploration of migration patterns across Austria‚Äôs nine Bundesl√§nder (federal states). The dashboard combines demographic visualizations with geospatial mapping to reveal the distribution and composition of Austria‚Äôs population with migration background.

title: Migration in Austria
text:
Dashboard Features

üìä Dynamic Bar Charts & Pictograms
The application offers multiple visualization modes:

Bar charts showing population distribution by various dimensions
Isotype pictograms where each icon represents 100,000 people
Color-coded categories for citizenship and origin countries



üó∫Ô∏è Interactive Choropleth Map

Hover over any Bundesland to see detailed statistics
Population with migration background (1st and 2nd generation)
Share percentages with color intensity encoding
Emoji-based pictograms overlaid on the map



üîß User Controls







Control
Options




Dimension
Citizenship, Country of Birth, Age & Gender, Parents‚Äô birthplace


Metric
Total population, Migration total, 1st Generation, 2nd Generation

title: Migration in Austria
text:
Technical Implementation


Code
# Core libraries
library(shiny)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
library(sf)
library(rnaturalearth)

# Key technical features:
# 1. Reactive filtering based on user input
# 2. Conditional rendering (pictogram vs bar chart)
# 3. sf spatial data with Austrian Bundesland boundaries
# 4. ggplotly conversion for interactive tooltips
# 5. Custom color palettes for citizenship categories

# Pictogram visualization (isotype chart)
ggplot(df_units, aes(x = col, y = row, colour = category)) +
  geom_text(
    label = "\U0001F9CD",  # Standing person emoji
    size = 7,
    family = "Apple Color Emoji"
  ) +
  facet_wrap(~ category, nrow = 1)

title: Migration in Austria
text:
Data Sources

Statistik Austria - Official population statistics
Mikrozensus-Arbeitskr√§fteerhebung - Labour force survey
rnaturalearth - Austrian administrative boundaries

title: Migration in Austria
text:
Screenshots & Demo






NoteLive Demo



This Shiny application requires a server to run interactively. See deployment options below.



Sample Outputs
The dashboard produces visualizations like:

Population by Citizenship - Pictogram showing Austrian nationals vs.¬†EU and non-EU citizens
Bundesland Map - Choropleth showing migration background concentration (highest in Vienna at ~46%)
Age & Gender Breakdown - Pink/blue bar charts for demographic analysis

title: Migration in Austria
text:
Deployment Options
To view this dashboard interactively, you have several options:

Option 1: ShinyApps.io (Recommended)
# Install rsconnect
install.packages("rsconnect")

# Deploy to shinyapps.io
library(rsconnect)
rsconnect::deployApp("path/to/app")


Option 2: Run Locally
# Clone the repository and run:
shiny::runApp("app.R")


Option 3: Shiny Server / Posit Connect
For organizational deployment with authentication and scaling.

title: Income Inequality Dynamics
text: This visualization captures the temporal dynamics of income inequality, illustrating how income distributions have shifted and evolved. The analysis tracks key inequality metrics such as Gini coefficients and income quintile ratios across time.

text:
Methodology

Data Sources

National statistical offices - Household income surveys
EU-SILC longitudinal data - Panel data for tracking changes



Technical Approach


Code

library(ggplot2)
library(scales)

# Time series analysis of inequality metrics
# Gini coefficient calculations
# Quintile ratio analysis (S80/S20)

# Visualization techniques:
# - Line plots for temporal trends
# - Area charts for distribution shifts
# - Annotations for key policy events




Key Features

Longitudinal perspective on inequality trends
Multiple metrics for comprehensive analysis
Context-aware annotations for interpretation

title: About
text:
I am a quantitative researcher with expertise in data visualization, statistical analysis, and interactive dashboard development. My work focuses on economic and social policy research, with particular interest in:

Income and wealth inequality analysis
Migration and integration statistics
Educational mobility research
Regional/spatial economics
